alert.note: Alert for Houghton; Keweenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 11:58PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT KEWEENAW AND NORTHEASTERN HOUGHTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM EDT... At 1156 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour over Lake Linden, or near Calumet, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Calumet, Eagle Harbor, Copper Harbor, Eagle River, Laurium, Lake Linden, Brockway Mountain, Bete Grise, Hubbell, Houghton County Airport, The Upper Entrance of Portage Canal, Lac La Belle, Phoenix, Mohawk, Gay, Allouez, Delaware, Copper City, Ahmeek, and Gratiot Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
